name: Warm for December: A Holiday Concert
description:
Join us as we explore the theme of "warmth", from sun-drenched travels to the American Southwest to the simple comforts of home and chosen family.

This year's holiday concert blends classical choral elegance with queer joy, featuring the works of classical composers alongside our holiday pop divas.

Come for an evening celebrating connection, belonging, and the glow of community. Ring in the season with some gaily good cheer!

name: Rhythm Section Band Concert: Ghanaian Highlife
description:
Presenting an evening of Ghanaian Highlife!

The Rhythm Section features veteran Highlife musicians, Dally Dominic on bass guitar, Kofi Ackah on drums, Quandoe Harrison on keyboards, George Kobby on vocals, Gabriel Amankwah on keyboards and Daniel Boateng on lead guitar. 

Their musicianship is exceptional, showcasing both innate talent and proficiency in their respective instruments. 

The Rhythm Section is rooted in Highlife and Afrobeat, honouring the foundation of Ghana music while bringing a fresh modern sound to every performance. Highlife is their origin. It is where they came from. It is the foundation that later gave birth to Afrobeat and they refuse to let that history fade.

name: A Very Merry Munsch Mas
description:
This holiday season, BenTastic and Magic Mel take the stage together for a Christmas celebration full of festive cheer, wonder, and magical surprises!

Packed with laughter, wonder, and plenty of audience participation, this high-energy show blends dazzling illusions, hilarious comedy, and heartwarming holiday spirit.

Kids and parents alike will be part of the magic as BenTastic and Magic Mel inspire families to discover their own inner sparkle while celebrating the joy of Christmas.

name: Jack and the Beans Talk: A Merry Magical Pantomime
description:
From the team behind Robin Hood, Pinnochio, and Cinderella, enjoy this magical and humorous stage adaptation of the classic Jack and the Beanstalk fairytale presented in traditional British pantomime.

Get ready for a delightfully absurd adventure packed with laughter, music and mayhem in this family-friendly production. 

Boo the villain and cheer the hero as we follow Jack as he ventures into a world of mystery and mischief. From a dastardly villain causing trouble to a friendly garden fairy and a talking cow named Daisy, this story is about imagination and where anything can happen. A night at the panto might be the most fun you'll have in the theatre this year. Join us!

name: DJ Skate Nights
description:
Make your winter Saturday nights epic! Glide across our newly improved, larger waterfront rink while top DJs spin the beats that keep the energy high all night long. 

Check out the full lineup below and make your moves on the ice!

name: The One Liner Show
description:
Shakespeare said, "Brevity is the soul of wit".

We took that to heart, then added music. Audiences have called The One Liner Show "fun," "innovative," and "one of a kind".

This edition features headliner Todd Graham and a carefully curated lineup of comedians, each with 4 minutes to deliver their sharpest short jokes, backed by a live jazz musician. No stories. No crowd work. No filler.

This isn't your typical stand-up show. It's a hybrid of stand-up and improvised jazz, a live collision of jokes and music. 

Created by and for those who love the art of the short joke, this show is presented by comedians Stephen Paylor and Eric Pillwein to carry on the spirit of the late, great Mitch Hedberg.

name: Friendly Rich and the Lollipop People live at DROM Taberna
description:
Friendly Rich is a mad composer from Oakville, Canada. Mr. Rich composed background music for three seasons of MTV's The Tom Green Show. Since 1994, he has recorded exclusively for his own eclectic record label, The Pumpkin Pie Corporation. Rich just completed his PhD in Music Education from the University of Toronto under the supervision of Dr. Lee Bartel. 

Friendly Rich and his modern music ensemble, The Lollipop People, have toured the world, sharing the stage with artists such as Of Montreal, The Tiger Lillies and Amanda Palmer.

name: Intentional Wreath Making
description:
Bright blessings this holiday season! 

Join Melanie and share in this ancient tradition of bringing nature inside during the longest, darkest, coldest nights to remind us that Spring will come again. 

Consciously harvested pine and cedar will be woven with other seasonal symbolism to set your winter intentions for you and yours wherever you hang your creation.

This workshop provides a chance to express creativity in alignment with the season, but also to share time and space with others in a joyful and playful atmosphere. Invite your friends and create together!

name: Selfies with Santa and Paws and Claus
description:
Bring the family and friends for some serious or goofy Christmas pictures with Santa!

There will be an onsite D.J. playing seasonal tunes and our elf will be giving out free reusable shopping bags.  Complimentary hot chocolate will be served to attendees while supplies last, and Cycle Toronto will be onsite offering free bike tune-ups.

Bring your pets too!

All activities are weather permitting.

name: Rock the Halls Benefit Concert
description:
Canada's Walk of Fame is turning up the holiday cheer with the return of our second annual benefit concert, in support of Daily Bread Food Bank!

Headlining the night is global pop star Priyanka along with YASSiN and Sean Terrio, alumni of the Canada's Walk of Fame RBC Emerging Musician Program, in collaboration with Stingray. They'll be joined by additional Emerging Musician Program alumni, including: Annabel Oreste (2025 Grand Prize Winner), Jennarie (2025 2nd Prize Winner), and Maya Malkin (2020 alumna), celebrating the season with music, joy and community spirit.

Attendees can also enjoy a silent auction, holiday photo activation, and participate in an on-site food drive collecting non-perishable donations. All proceeds from ticket sales and the auction will go directly toward helping families in need this holiday season.
